C2 having similar features to another thing and therefore able to be compared with it: analogous to The experience of a mystic trance is in a sense analogous to sleep or drunkenness. The emergency vehicle for the International Space Station is analogous to a lifeboat. See
analogy

art, physics
  specialized (of colours) next to each other on the colour wheel (= a diagram showing colours in a circle so you can see the relationships between them) and therefore similar: Analagous colours are often found in nature, for example in the changing colours of autumn leaves progressing around the colour wheel. An analagous colour scheme is characterized by a lack of contrast, unlike a complementary colour scheme. Compare
complementary
non-complementary
More examplesFewer examplesThe two TV programmes - set in different cities - are roughly analogous big-city police dramas.These are two analogous situations.San Francisco's Golden Gate Park is spectacular and not in any way analogous to New York's Central Park.The way a string vibrates is somewhat analogous to the way ripples spread out in water.Analogous colours are harmonious colours which sit side by side on the colours wheel — related colours such as yellow, yellow-orange, orange, orange-red, and red.
